page.title: 05Farming around Rivenhall
page.content: There are eleven farms in the area around Rivenhall.They are mainly mixed having both crops and animals.The animals are mainly cattle with some farms having pigs and sheep and one farm having 22000 poultry.The farms range from 150 to 1300 acres.The crops grown on the land are wheat, barley, beans, rape-seed, corn, sugarbeet, peas, grass, potatoes, blackcurrants and willow trees for cricket bats.The farms employ a varying number of people,the maximum being 17.The machines used are combine harvesters, bailers, tractors, lorries, fork lift trucks, sugarbeet harvesters and blackcurrant harvesters.The produce from one of these farms in one year is approximately 100 tons wheat,120 tons potatoes,180 tons sugarbeet, 25 tons blackcurrants and a maximum of 20 trees per day.
